clap.modules.node.module¶

Module Contents¶

clap.modules.node.module.start_nodes(instance_ids: Dict[str, int]) → List[NodeInfo]¶

Start instances based on the instance configuration values

Parameters

instance_ids (Dict[str, int]) – Dictionary containing the instance name as key and number of instances as value. The instance name must match the instance name at instances configuration file

Returns

A list of created nodes

Return type

List[NodeInfo]

clap.modules.node.module.list_nodes(node_ids: List[str] = None, tags: Dict[str, str] = None) → List[NodeInfo]¶

Get the information of nodes from the node repository

Parameters

  • node_ids (List[str]) – List of node ids to get the node information. If no node_ids and no tags are informed, all nodes are retrieved

  • tags (Dict[str, str]) – Key-valued dictionary informing the nodes to get, matching the tags informed. The nodes containing all tag values are retieved.

Returns

A list with nodes information

Return type

List[NodeInfo]

clap.modules.node.module.is_alive(node_ids: List[str], tags: Dict[str, str] = None) → Dict[str, bool]¶

Check if nodes are alive, based on their node ids. The nodes are alive if a successfully SSH connection is performed

Parameters

  • node_ids (List[str]) – List of node ids to check for aliveness.

  • tags (Dict[str, str]) – Optionally check nodes that match the tags informed

Returns

A dictionary telling which nodes are alive. The dictionary keys correspond to the node id and the value is a boolean that is true if node is alive or false otherwise.

Return type

Dict[str, bool]

clap.modules.node.module.stop_nodes(node_ids: List[str], tags: Dict[str, str] = None, force: bool = True) → List[str]¶

Stop started nodes based on their node ids

Parameters

  • node_ids (List[str]) – List of node ids to stop

  • tags (Dict[str, str]) – Optionally stop nodes that match the tags informed

Returns

A list of stopped nodes

Return type

List[str]

clap.modules.node.module.resume_nodes(node_ids: List[str], tags: Dict[str, str] = None) → List[str]¶

Resume stopped nodes based on their node ids

Parameters

  • node_ids (List[str]) – List of node ids to resume

  • tags (Dict[str, str]) – Optionally resume nodes that match the tags informed

Returns

A list of resumed nodes

Return type

List[str]

clap.modules.node.module.pause_nodes(node_ids: List[str], tags: Dict[str, str] = None) → List[str]¶

Pause nodes based on their node ids

Parameters

  • node_ids (List[str]) – List of node ids to pause

  • tags (Dict[str, str]) – Optionally pause nodes that match the tags informed

Returns

A list of paused nodes

Return type

List[str]

clap.modules.node.module.execute_playbook(playbook_file: str, node_ids: List[str], tags: Dict[str, str] = None, extra_args: Dict[str, str] = None) → Dict[str, bool]¶

Execute an Ansible Playbook at nodes based on their node ids.

Parameters

  • playbook_file (str) – Path of the Ansible playbook to execute.

  • node_ids (List[str]) – List of node ids to execute the playbook

  • tags (Dict[str, str]) – Optionally execute playbook at nodes that match the tags informed

  • extra_args (Dict[str, str]) – Key-valued dictionary containing the extra variables to be passed to the playbook. Both key and value are strings

Returns

A dictionary telling which nodes have sucessfully executed the playbook. The dictionary keys correspond to the node id and the value is a boolean that is true if node successfully executed the playbook or false otherwise.

Return type

Dict[str, bool]

clap.modules.node.module.get_ssh_connections(node_ids: List[str], tags: Dict[str, str] = None, *args, **kwargs) → Dict[str, SSHClient]¶

Get a SSH client to nodes.

Parameters

  • node_ids (List[str]) – List of node ids to get the clients.

  • tags (Dict[str, str]) – Optionally get connections to nodes that match the tags informed

Returns

A dictionary with the SSH clients. The key is the node id and each value is the SSH client (from Paramiko library)

Return type

Dict[str, Paramiko.SSHClient]

clap.modules.node.module.connect_to_node(node_id: str)¶

Open a SSH shell to a node based on it node id
